DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine if a dose of 40 mg dexamethasone is more effective as pain treatment than the currently used dose of 8 mg after arthroscopic shoulder surgery.
DOC.brief_title: Dexamethasone for Pain After Shoulder Surgery
DOC.criteria: Arthroscopic subacromial decompression and/or acromioclavicular resection General anaesthesia Daysurgery, Horsens Hospital Incompetent Pregnant Age under 18 or over 90 years Allergy toward dexamethasone Diabetes Active gastric ulcer Untreated hypertension Glaucoma Daily use of glucocorticoids or strong opioids Daily use of analgesics for unrelated illness Myasthenia gravis Mitochondrial disorders
